page.title: 20Sports Day at Anston Brook
page.content: Mrs.B.Moseley, the Junior school's first{parent-governor,}describes our Sports Day (10th.July 1985). Today is my younger son's school {sports day.}This takes place on the school sports field and is when the children at the school compete informally in a variety of races. There are straightforward running races and very entertaining novelty events, such as the egg and spoon race, the sack race and the obstacle race. My son is entered for the sack race. The children stand with their feet in a sack and hop or shuffle to the finishing line. This is not a serious competetive occasion but an informal gathering of children, their parents and school staff, all of whom seem to enjoy themselves. There is often a staff/parents race which the children greatly enjoy.
